title: Netanyahu Says Israel Wants to Take Military Control of All of Gaza
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, made the remarks ahead of a security cabinet meeting, although military leaders are wary of expanding operations in the territory.

title: How a Pro-Palestinian Group Fell Foul of a Long Unused U.K. Terrorism Law
summary: The protest group Palestine Action does not promote violence against people. But after it damaged military property, the British government banned it as a terrorist organization.

title: Trump Delayed a Medicare Change After Health Companies’ Donations
summary: The president posted talking points provided by one firm that donated millions, and his administration delayed a change on coverage of pricey bandages that could have hurt the company and others like it.

title: Trump Demands New U.S. Census That Excludes Undocumented Immigrants
summary: The push comes as the president and his allies are pressing Republican-led states to redraw their congressional maps to benefit their party.

title: As Trump Administration Plans to Burn Contraceptives, Europeans Are Alarmed
summary: The U.S. government intends to incinerate $9.7 million in already-purchased birth control in Belgium after U.S.A.I.D shut down. Destruction may have already started.

title: On Vaccines, RFK Jr. Has Broken Sharply With the Mainstream
summary: While many officials and scientists embrace other parts of the secretary’s agenda, his stance on vaccines is alienating allies who fear a public health crisis.

title: Targeting a Vaccine
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has halted funding for mRNA shots. We explore why.

title: Former F.D.A. Chief Backs RFK Jr.’s War on Ultraprocessed Food
summary: Dr. David A. Kessler has outlined a legal path for Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to take on the food industry, while testing President Trump’s willingness to do so.

title: Swiss Businesses Fear Being ‘Annihilated’ by One of the World’s Highest Tariffs
summary: Goods shipped from the country face a 39% tariff in the U.S., which companies warn will have dire consequences if President Trump cannot be quickly dissuaded.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Could Raise Prices on Many Consumer Goods
summary: The tariffs are driving up prices on everyday goods as businesses warn they can no longer absorb costs, leaving consumers to foot the bill.

title: Eleven Women, Nine Dogs, Not Much Drama (and No Guys)
summary: These retired women in Texas have been through infertility, illness, layoffs, addiction and disappointing marriages. Now they are trying to create a utopia just for themselves.

title: Cornyn Says F.B.I. Will Help Find Texas Lawmakers Who Left State
summary: The senator said the agency had agreed to help locate Democratic state legislators who departed to try to block a vote on congressional maps. Democrats said federal law enforcement was being misused.

title: State Representative Gene Wu Is Leading the Texas’ Redistricting Fight
summary: State Representative Gene Wu represents a racially diverse corner of Houston when he’s not defending juveniles in court. The battle over redistricting has pushed him into the national spotlight.

title: For Putin, Trump Summit Is Key to Securing Ukraine Goals
summary: The Russian leader sees direct talks with Trump as essential to achieving his ultimate aims in Ukraine.

title: Cuomo Tells Business Leaders He Doesn’t ‘Personally’ Want to Fight Trump
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s remarks about President Trump came just before The Times’s disclosure that he had spoken to Mr. Trump about the race.

title: ‘Fleetwood Mac’ at 50: A Marvel of Serendipity and Perfectionism
summary: The album that turned the band into superstars is getting an anniversary rerelease that shows why it still gleams.

title: The Rise of Silicon Valley’s Techno-Religion
summary: The Rationalists, a community focused on the risks of artificial intelligence, regularly gather with tech figures and other like-minded people in a complex that covers much of a city block.

title: OpenAI Unveils GPT-5, New AI Model, to ChatGPT Users
summary: The A.I. start-up said its new flagship technology was faster, more accurate and less likely to make stuff up.

title: Right-Wing Influence Shaped the Sydney Sweeney Ad Debate
summary: Right-wing commentators suggested there was widespread criticism of Ms. Sweeney over her new ad campaign. There wasn’t, at least at first.

title: Sallie Bingham, Author at the Center of a Newspaper Drama, Dies at 88
summary: A novelist and memoirist, she famously clashed with her brother, leading to the fall of a Kentucky publishing dynasty that her paternal grandfather established in 1918.

title: Judges Are Under Threat. This Is No Way to Run a Country.
summary: Federal judges are under threat across the nation.

title: The Next Parenting Trend Starts Before Conception
summary: For as little as $2,500, you can choose your future baby. Should you?

title: Perito Moreno Glacier Is Thinning Faster Than Expected, Study Shows
summary: After holding steady for decades, the beloved Perito Moreno has thinned considerably since 2019, scientists said.

title: Skydance Takes Over Paramount, and a New Era Begins
summary: The merger catapults new power players to the top of Hollywood and ends a tortuous process that has lasted well over a year.

title: The Atlantic Hurricane Season May Be About to Intensify
summary: Experts at NOAA updated their prediction for the Atlantic on Thursday. Forecasters say there could be up to nine hurricanes before the end of November.

title: How Ozempic Maker Novo Nordisk Lost Its Shine
summary: The pioneering Danish drugmaker was once the most valuable company in Europe, but analysts say a number of missteps reversed its fortunes.
